intro: Rhododendron × lysolepis, commonly known as the snowball bush, is a hybrid evergreen shrub native to the Himalayas. It is characterized by its dense clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has leathery, dark green leaves that are typically arranged in whorls around the stems. It thrives in cool, moist climates and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes for its showy floral display.
